strings: <Cap><leader> discovers a new recipe for the alchemy pot!
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3>
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3> + <Cap><string_4>
<se_high>*: The Princess who lives here is a wonderful, wonderful princess.
<se_high>*: The King's ill, so she's doing everything for him. All the work of the royal family!<page>*: It's the same job they've been doing for generations.
<se_high>*: But it's hard for her on her own. I'm sure it would make her happy if you helped her.
<se_low>*: Ah ha! <IF_SOLO>A visitor<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>Visitors<ENDIF_SOLO>! How many years has it been, I wonder!?
<se_low>*: Well then, I suppose you've brought some of those little trinkets along with you, haven't you?
<se_low>*: Ah, good! Then take them to the Princess at once! She will be delighted. You can find her upstairs.
<se_low>*: What!? What am I talking about!?
<se_low>*: Those lovely little round thingamajigs of course! What else could I be referring to!?
<se_high>*: My brother works in the casino in a town called Pickham.
<se_high>*: He's a dealer in a bingo game! At least, I think that's what he said. Anyway, he's got a really good job there, and he's MY brother!

<se_high>*: And I'm going to be even better than him!
I'm going to work really hard, and be the best there is!
<se_def>*: Ever since I saw that eerie clown walking o'er the water, I haven't dared venture out on the waters again.<page>*: Me sea legs have gone a-walkin', see!?
<se_def>*: Now I'm stuck here on this little island with not a finger o' grog, nor a board to scrub down.
<se_def>*: If you're searching for that clown who can walk o'er water, he was on a westerly course.<page>*: If he held the rudder firm, he would've been landing not far from Baccarat, I dare say.

<se_def>*: I don't know no more.
And I don't much want to.

<se_def>*: I seen a thing I ain't never should've gone
and seen!

<se_def>*: It was a moonless night at sea.
Not a glimmer on the waves...<page>*: I saw a man dressed like a clown walking<endash> ...Nay, creeping, he was...o'er the very surface of the brine!

<se_def>*: He was more terrifying than a sea dragon,
I tell you!
<se_def>*: What!? You want to know where he went!?

<se_def>*: He was heading west. On the route to
Baccarat, I'd say. Huuurrgh, it shivers me
timbers just thinking about it!

<se_high>*: Sssh!
Kindly have some consideration for the sick!
<se_high>*: His Majesty is not well. I would ask you not to get him excited, please.

<se_low>*: ...I haven't seen your <IF_SOLO>face<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>faces<ENDIF_SOLO> before.
Who are you?
<se_low>King of Medals: Urrgh... Just opening my mouth is painful these days. Curse this useless body of mine!
<se_high>*: All the monsters who live in the castle have been taken in by the Princess.<page>*: She helped them when they were too badly injured or weak from hunger to move.
<se_high>*: She never leaves the weak to suffer, not even monsters. The Princess is a wonderfully kind<->hearted lady.
<se_def>*: I want to be of some use to the Princess, but that means leaving her side to search for medals.
<se_def>*: It's just too painful! I don't know if I could bear to spend even one day away from her!
<se_def>*: So I've decided to try serenading her instead. Maybe my voice will make her happy and I won't have to leave. Doremini! ♪
<se_low>*: When His Majesty was in good health we had a great many visitors to the island, bringing with them a great many medals.
<se_low>*: I'm sure collecting the medals is more than a royal obligation in the Princess's eyes.<page>*: It is a way for her to recapture the past when her father was well.
<se_low>*: I'm expecting you to do your bit, <IF_SOLO>traveller<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>travellers<ENDIF_SOLO>, and bring her plenty of medals!

<se_high>*: Sssh!
Kindly have some consideration for the sick!
<se_high>*: His Majesty is not well. I would ask you not to get him excited, please.
<se_low>King of Medals: Now then, young <IF_SOLO>traveller<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>travellers<ENDIF_SOLO>! Are you going to help the Princess with her task of gathering medals?
<se_low>King of Medals: ...Urrgh! Ahem...AHEM!

<se_low>King of Medals: Ah, you're back again.
And have you been gathering medals?
<se_low>King of Medals: Good, good! The Princess is doing a wonderful job of coordinating everything.

<se_low>King of Medals: I can't leave it to her for too long.
I must rid myself of this cursed illnes<endash>
Urrrgh...
<se_low>King of Medals: Ahem! Ahem!
<se_low>King of Medals: Oh, you haven't managed to find any.<page>King of Medals: Have you tried looking anywhere other than treasure chests? You can find them in pots and barrels too, you know.

<se_low>King of Medals: But I'm well aware they're not easy items
to locate. They are ‘mini’ after all!
Still, don't give up!
<se_high>*: Goodness! You do realise it's the middle of the night, don't you!? It's really not the best time.
<se_high>*: His Majesty is already resting for the night. I'm afraid I must ask you to leave!
<se_low>King of Medals: Ahem! Ahem!

<se_low>King of Medals: Ooooh. I start to feel even worse at night.
This body of mine is naught but a worthless sack of agues and rheum!
<se_high>*: (YAWN!) ...I'm ready for bed now.
<se_def>*: I tried seranading the Princess with heavy<->medal music, but her maid got angry and said it sounded like I was strangling a cat!
<se_def>*: I suppose I was partly in the wrong for singing when the King was asleep, but she didn't have to be quite so harsh.
<se_def>*: I'm sure the Princess would have asked me to stop in a much more gracious way...
<se_def>*: That monster of a maid isn't a patch on her.
<se_high>*: When the Princess is talking to you<IF_SOLO><ELSE_NOT_SOLO> and your friends<ENDIF_SOLO>, <leader>, she always smiles.
<se_high>*: And whenever she smiles, I can't help smiling too! So come back to play again soon. Come lots!
<se_low>*: You've certainly collected a good number of medals! I'm most impressed.
<se_low>*: It just goes to prove the shrewdness of the Princess's eye. She was very wise to choose you.
<se_low>*: The royal family is in fine hands with her on the throne.
<se_low>*: All we need now is for her to accept a fine young gentleman as her king, and everything will fall into place.
<se_low>*: Well, Master <hero>, do you think you might perhaps make a good medal king in the future?

<se_high>Princess of Medals: I'm afraid I have nothing left to give you.
But I do hope you'll visit me from time to time.

<se_high>Princess of Medals: Even when I'm a little down in the dumps,
I know that seeing you<IF_SOLO><ELSE_NOT_SOLO> and your friends<ENDIF_SOLO> will cheer me up no end, <most_heroic>!

<se_high>Princess of Medals: The royal minister really does say some outrageous things on occasion.
Marriage simply is not<endash>

<se_high>Princess of Medals: Oh, dear me! He didn't say anything to you,
did he, <most_heroic>?
<se_high>Princess of Medals: He did!? Oh, dear! I implore you, <most_heroic>, pay no attention to anything he says.
<se_high>Princess of Medals: One is so frightfully embarrassed! One shall have to have serious words with the man!
<se_high>Princess of Medals: Thank goodness! Although, I must say... Hmmm, King <Cap><hero> and Queen Minnie...

<se_low>King of Medals: Ah good! You've returned. What?
You're surprised to see me here?

<se_low>King of Medals: Ha ha ha! Yes, yes! I'm much better now.
I can finally get out of bed!
<se_low>King of Medals: Now then! From what I hear, you've collected so many medals, we've run out of rewards for you.
<se_low>King of Medals: I've been the King of Medals for many a long year, and I must say you are the first to achieve such an outstanding feat!
<se_low>King of Medals: Well done! You are <IF_SOLO>a true medal hunter<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>true medal hunters<ENDIF_SOLO>.
<se_low>King of Medals: I've been informed that you have gathered more medals than there exist rewards for.

<se_low>King of Medals: In all my long years as the King of Medals,
I can honestly say you are the first to achieve such dizzying heights of excellence.
<se_low>King of Medals: Well done! You are <IF_SOLO>a true medal hunter<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>true medal hunters<ENDIF_SOLO>.

<se_high>*: His Majesty has regained his strength now.
I must say it's a relief. It was quite a responsibility looking after him, you know.
<se_high>*: It all started to get better from the moment you came to the castle that first time.
<se_def>*: It seems I must admit defeat when it comes to making the Princess happy.
<se_def>*: My songs could never make her smile as much as you just did...
<se_def>*: But I mustn't fret! The main thing is that she's happy. It doesn't matter to me who made her that way.

<se_high>*: His Majesty has regained his strength now.
It's a relief, I must say.
<se_high>*: He used to suffer from terrible coughing fits in the night, but now he sleeps peacefully.

<se_low>King of Medals: Ah, ah, aaah-pheeeeew....
Ah, ah, aaah-pheeew...
<se_def>*: It's funny, but that maid who serves the King hasn't been shouting at me lately. She seems a lot happier all of a sudden...
<se_def>*: She was probably just a bit tense before because of the King's ill health and everything.
<se_def>*: I suppose I was unfair to call her a monster. She's not all that bad, really.
